TypeScript

Summary

A strongly typed superset of JavaScript

Jots

Type Alias

Shorthand notation for describing type characteristics. Itâ€™s evaluated as if you had typed out the aliased type information.

Cannot be reopened or extended

Looks and acts a bit like Python type aliases if you squint

type is the keyword for type aliases.

type Point = {
	x: number;
    y: number;
}

You cannot subclass from a type, but you can extend it via intersection

type Point3D = Point & {
  z: number;
}

Interface

interface uses a similar shorthand, but the resulting Interface can be extended.

interface Point = {
	x: number;
    y: number;
}

interface Point3D extends Point {
  z: number;
}

Related

TypeScript: JavaScript With Syntax For Types.
